intro: Conocephalus microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved conocephalus, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soil. Its small, narrow leaves and delicate inflorescence contribute to its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
